conclusion: To find the average velocity and average speed of the particle, we need to calculate the total distance traveled, total time taken, and then the average velocity and speed.
The particle moves along two semi-circular arcs, each with a radius of 1 m.
The total distance traveled by the particle is the sum of the lengths of the two arcs.
The length of a semi-circle with radius r is given by the formula: Length of semi-circle = (1/2) π r^2.
Length of upper arc = (1/2) π (1)^2 = (1/2) π m.
Length of lower arc = (1/2) π (1)^2 = (1/2) π m.
Total distance traveled = Length of upper arc + Length of lower arc = π m.
The particle takes 5 seconds to travel the total distance of π m.
Average velocity = Total distance / Total time = π/5 m/s.
Average speed = Total distance / Total time = π/5 m/s.
The average velocity of the particle is π/5 m/s, and the average speed is also π/5 m/s.
